properties.title: Liacouras savors fruits of his vision for Temple
properties.description: The dynamism that made him a visionary president of Temple University for 19 years remains for Peter Liacouras, though it is restricted by a stroke that has left him partially paralyzed and in a wheelchair.

properties.title: Developer of Hard Rock in A.C. gets casino-license extension
Study: Extreme flooding risk at N.J. coast has doubled
properties.description: A new scientific study says the chance of flooding bad enough to once be dubbed once-a-century events has more than doubled along the coast of New Jersey and elsewhere.

properties.title: Boozing fruit flies shed light on addiction
properties.description: A jilted male fruit fly will try to drown his sorrows in drink if given the chance, according to a University of California study released today.

properties.title: Traffic Alert: Eastbound I-76 closed in Phila
properties.description: Eastbound I-76 has been closed at the Vine Street Expressway (I-676) because of a crash involving an overturned garbage truck.

properties.title: Ronnie Polaneczky: Bill that would mandate invasive vaginal tests has infuriated some women
properties.description:
SO YESTERDAY I was at Starbucks with Kathleen Kane, discussing our transvaginal ultrasounds.
I had one 17 years ago, after a miscarriage. Kane underwent three of them in more recent years, also after losing a pregnancy.

properties.title: Upbeat Santorum works for next win
properties.description: WASHINGTON - An upbeat Rick Santorum barreled into Puerto Rico on Wednesday in pursuit of another campaign-bending victory in a Republican presidential race where suddenly no primary is too minor and no delegate is conceded. Mitt Romney put nearly $1 million into television advertising in Illinois, the next big-state showdown.

properties.title: Video shows pair sought in $50,000 stickup
properties.description: Police have released surveillance photos of two men sought in the $50,000 gunpoint robbery of a man they met on the pretense of buying his car in North Philadelphia.

properties.title: Nutter: Feed the hungry, but indoors, not in parks
properties.description: HUNDREDS OF the city's hungry gather daily on the Benjamin Franklin Parkway and at LOVE Park for free food, but those days may be numbered.

properties.title: Disabilities advocates file lawsuit
properties.description: HARRISBURG - Advocates for people with mental illness and intellectual disabilities filed a lawsuit Wednesday claiming that Gov. Corbett and executive agencies violated state law by requesting too little funding for services.

properties.title: Nutter plans to end feedings of the homeless on the Parkway
properties.description: Mayor Nutter on Wednesday announced plans to end the feeding of large numbers of hungry and homeless people in city parks, saying he wanted to provide indoor meals instead.

properties.title: Grocery co-op to open in September in Elkins Park
properties.description: Elkins Park's tiny downtown has not been the same since Ashbourne Market closed in 2002.

properties.title: New veterans cemetery in Camden to be dedicated Memorial Day weekend
properties.description: On each side of the elegant double gate on Kaighns Avenue, large granite monoliths will honor each branch of the military.

properties.title: Bail hiked for defendant in fraudulent license scheme
properties.description: A Philadelphia man accused of tampering with public records to issue fraudulent driver's licenses at the Malvern Driver's License Center was held for trial Wednesday.

properties.title: Willistown Twp. bridge to reopen
properties.description: The Whitehorse Road bridge over Crum Creek in Willistown Township, which has been closed since September for structural repairs, will reopen Friday afternoon, PennDot said today.

properties.title: Courts or polls may be next stop in Pa. voter ID law fight
properties.description: HARRISBURG - The long debate in the legislature is over. The next battlegrounds for Pennsylvania's new law requiring voters to present photo identification may be the courts - or the polls.

properties.title: Phila. couple accused of beating, burning woman lured on chat line
properties.description: A North Philadelphia couple and two other people have been charged with beating and setting on fire a 20-year-old woman lured from Pittsburgh through a chat line, the District Attorney's Office said Wednesday.

properties.title: Cops: Man kills another near kids at play in N. Phila.
properties.description:
Cops: Man kills another near kids at play 
*Â Edgeley Street near 23rd
A 28-year-old man died at a hospital after being shot in the chest and arm yesterday in North Philadelphia, police said.

properties.title: Fire displaces 11 in North Phila.
properties.description: Eleven people from three families were displaced by a fire early today in a rowhouse in North Philadelphia's Fairhill neighborhood.

properties.title: Philadelphia police arrest two at immigrant-rights rally
properties.description: Declaring themselves "undocumented, unapologetic, and unafraid," two college students, both illegal immigrants, were arrested by Philadelphia police Wednesday after a boisterous immigrant-rights protest that snarled traffic for more than an hour.

properties.title: Riding SEPTA? Watch out for your cellphone
properties.description: IF YOU DON'T want to join the hundreds of SEPTA riders screaming "iYiYi! My iPhone!" as their smart handhelds disappear into the smarter hands of quick-grab thieves, you better heed the urgent warnings now blasting over public-address systems on subway and El trains.

properties.title: Kevin Riordan: Failsafe program teaches Camden residents skills at construction sites
properties.description:
The blueprints for a seniors residential complex in Camden have shown Darrin Ferguson the way toward a career.
"I've been unemployed for a while, and just looking at the plans and being out in the field have been great for me," says the father of three, who is shadowing construction-management professionals on the job.

properties.title: Teen suspect in musician's slaying also charged in theft
properties.description: The Morrisville teenager charged with the murder of Levittown musician Danny DeGennaro was arrested last week on an unrelated theft charge, Falls Township police said Wednesday.

properties.title: Phoenixville man sentenced in tax evasion scheme
properties.description: A 39-year-old Phoenixville man who once served as a Limerick Township supervisor was sentenced to four years in federal prison Wednesday in connection with a tax evasion scheme that included mail fraud.

properties.title: Wider Afghan role set for 2013
properties.description: WASHINGTON - Determined to show momentum in a war marred by setbacks, President Obama and British Prime Minster David Cameron said for the first time Wednesday that NATO forces would hand over the lead combat role to Afghan forces next year as the United States and its allies aim to get out by the end of 2014.

properties.title: Council chief Clarke promises budget transparency, but won't say how
properties.description: Apparently immune to irony, new City Council President Darrell L. Clarke on Wednesday promised more transparency in Council's budget and then would not say how it would happen.

properties.title: Payne's 'gentle power' recalled
properties.description: NEWARK, N.J. - Rep. Donald Payne was a modest man who favored quiet persuasion over bombast, qualities that did not detract from his effectiveness as an advocate for the most vulnerable in the United States and abroad, friends and colleagues recalled at his funeral Wednesday.

properties.title: Tattle: Eva Marie Saint recalls Hitch
properties.description: OSCAR-WINNING actress Eva Marie Saint will be at the Prince Music Theater tonight for a screening of Alfred Hitchcock's classic 1959 romantic suspense film, "North By Northwest."

properties.title: Blocking traffic on behalf of undocumented
properties.description: IN THEIR BOLDEST action here yet, illegal-immigrant activists sat down and blocked traffic in front of the federal immigration office at 16th and Callowhill streets yesterday, demanding the release of a man who is in detention and chanting for their human rights.

properties.title: Budget show hits the road
properties.description: FOR THE FIRST time in two years, City Council took its show on the road last night, kicking off the budget season with a community hearing in Southwest Philadelphia.

properties.title: Man guilty of 1990 slaying, faces murder charge
properties.description:
SANTO Mancuso, convicted of killing a prostitute in 1990, was held for trial yesterday in a second slaying.
Mancuso allegedly repeatedly stabbed Joseph Testa in the chest just minutes after this year began, authorities said.

properties.title: More budget info to come?
properties.description: A PPARENTLY immune to irony, City Council President Darrell Clarke yesterday promised more transparency in Council's budget and then refused to say how that will happen.

properties.title: 4 relatives charged in luring, beating & burning of Pittsburgh woman
properties.description: MEMBERS of a North Philly family are facing charges including attempted murder, aggravated assault and arson after they allegedly lured a 20-year-old Pittsburgh woman to Philadelphia and then held her in their home, brutally beat her and set her on fire before sending her on a bus back home.

properties.title: BILL'S AN ABORTION
properties.description:
THEY'RE WILLING 
to get arrested for their 
DREAM. Page 8

properties.title: Last student injured in fatal Chesterfield bus crash leaves hospital
properties.description: The last student to remain hospitalized following a Burlington County school bus crash last month that killed a classmate was to be moved to a rehabilitation facility on Wednesday, according to a Cooper University Hospital spokeswoman.

properties.title: Gloucester County man shoots girlfriend, kills self, officials say
properties.description: A 48-year-old man shot and wounded his girlfriend and then killed himself early Wednesday during an argument in the house they shared in a quiet Gloucester County neighborhood, officials said.

properties.title: Council opens budget season with SW Phila. community meeting
properties.description: For the first time in two years, City Council took its show on the road Wednesday night, kicking off the budget season with a community hearing in Southwest Philadelphia.

properties.title: S. Phila. man held for trial in fatal stabbing on New Year's
properties.description:
At 12:11 a.m. Jan. 1, the New Year's fireworks were just ending.
In the 2500 block of South Jessup Street in South Philadelphia, they were about to begin.

properties.title: Two undocumented immigrants arrested in protest
properties.description: Declaring themselves "undocumented, unapologetic and unafraid," two college students were arrested by Philadelphia police Wednesday after a boisterous street protest that snarled traffic for more than an hour.

properties.title: Courts or polls may be next stop in Pa. voter ID law fight
properties.description: HARRISBURG - The long debate in the legislature is over. The next battlegrounds for Pennsylvania's new law requiring voters to present photo identification may be the courts - or the polls.

properties.title: Four charged with setting woman on fire
2 convicted in Frankford drug ring
properties.description: Two men were convicted by a federal jury today of participating in a multimillion-dollar drug organization that distributed hundreds of kilograms of cocaine and crack in the city's Frankford section.

properties.title: City Council goes on the road
properties.description: For the first time in two years, City Council took its show on the road Wednesday night, kicking off the budget season with a community hearing in Southwest Philadelphia.

properties.title: In art, exploring her adopted life
properties.description:
In the world of Chinese adoption, Sarah Mitteldorf stands at the edge of the known universe.
She came first - or among the very first, landing in the United States as a baby in early 1986. That was five years before the People's Republic loosened its laws to allow foreign adoption, and a decade before it began sending children here in large numbers.

properties.title: Man guilty in 1990 slaying faces new murder charge
properties.description: SANTO Mancuso, convicted of killing a prostitute in 1990, was held for trial Wednesday in a second slaying.

properties.title: Riding SEPTA? Watch out for your cell phone
properties.description: If you don't want to join the hundreds of SEPTA riders screaming "iYiYi! My iPhone!" as their smart handhelds disappear into the smarter hands of quick-grab thieves, you better heed the urgent warnings blasting over public address systems on subway and El trains these days.

properties.title: Man, 28, killed in N. Phila.
properties.description: A 28-year-old man was fatally shot late Wednesday afternoon in North Philadelphia, police said.

properties.title: Cyber-school kids truant, failing, and teachers have been dumped
properties.description: IT ALL SOUNDED so good on paper: a "global high school of the 21st century," a cyber school that would teach about 300 students two languages and keep them constantly engaged in learning.

properties.title: City Howl Help Desk: Mind your pees and phews: Dump here & urine good company
properties.description: THE WATER bottles lying in a pile on Buttonwood Street were not filled with water. Their contents were a mysterious, yellow liquid - one closer to brown, the others the color of lemonade.

properties.title: Reward posted in tire slashings
properties.description: A $7,500 reward is being offered for the arrest of whoever is responsible for slicing the tires of at least 55 cars in Northeast Philadelphia since December.
